Work

Notitia

Notitia was a group project, it is an app that was built in a team of 3 people, using Git version control, we developed an app where users are able to post about topics and/or subjects they are interested in teaching or learning from others.

They would create a post with certain specifications and you could message them and leave a review, and to find a specific post, we used AngularJS filtering systems (which we built on) to filter posts by a date range, radius or Post type (teaching or learning).

For this project I built out the majority of the back end with Node.JS, focusing on the routes, CRUD, authentication, models and MongoDB. Building these foundations allowed the team to focus on the design on the app, also complex and key functionality using the Google Maps API. I also worked on the functionality of the filtering system.

Technologies Used

  • JavaScript ES6
  • Node.js
  • HTML5
  • Express
  • GIT
  • GitHub
  • Gulp
  • Amazon Web Services (S3)
  • Bootstrap (grid only)
  • AngularJS
  • Mocha
  • SASS
  • MongoDB
  • Bower
  • JSON

ANAGRAM FALLS

Anagram Falls was my first project I had ever worked on, the end goal was to create a game using JavaScript ES6, HTML and CSS.

I wanted to involve a problem solving aspect to my game, which is why I involved anagrams as an integral part.

The game was a simple idea, where anagrams would fall from top to bottom and you would have to solve them before they reached the bottom. Losing a life when they did, the higher the difficuluty chosen the faster they would fall and the more you would have to solve to beat the round.

Technologies Used

  • JavaScript ES6
  • jQuery
  • HTML5
  • SASS

justo

Justo was a group project, it is an app that was built in a team of 4 people, using Git version control, we developed an app in which users could sign up as either developer looking for work, or business owners looking for developers.

Business owners could post projects they wanted to be done with a budget, tech stack and deadlines, and developers could bid on these projects so the business owner could go with a cheaper bid and check out the developer's profile where others would have written reviews.

We implemented in an in-app messaging system for all users to communicate in. (no gem used for this)

For this project I spent the majority of the time working on the front end utilising AngularJS to provide the many views involved for users and getting all the data that was needed through to the view from the controllers and setting up the routes on the front-end.

Technologies Used

  • JavaScript ES6
  • Ruby
  • Bootstrap (grid only)
  • AngularJS
  • GitHub
  • Bower
  • Gulp
  • HTML5
  • Ruby on Rails
  • GIT
  • SASS
  • AWS Web Services (S3)
  • PostgreSQL
  • JSON

InfoGram

Infogram is an app using the Google Vision API, which would, take the users upload and then give them back information based on picture uploaded, i.e. Golden Gate Bridge would give the user back its location and a filtering system to find key places nearby.

This app included CRUD functionality, and was also RESTful. With users being able to log in and register, using comments on other peoples posts

Technologies Used

  • JavaScript ES6
  • Node.js
  • HTML5
  • Express
  • Google Maps
  • JSON
  • Amazon Web Services (S3)
  • Bulma
  • jQuery
  • Bower
  • SASS
  • Google Vision &
  • Google Places API(s)
  • Gulp
